RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Judge Ricardo Garcia Regional Detention: Judge Ricardo Garcia Regional Detention Center

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Juvenile Justice Department: department where juveniles may be committed after violating probation conditions, as part of rehabilitation program and ordered for commitment by the juvenile court, providing a variety of services including behavioral, family counseling, anger management, responsibility, substance abuse, mental health, and educational programs. J.M.E. was committed to this department.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Ricardo Garcia Regional Detention: detention center where J.M.E. failed to comply with requirements even after a second chance, was unsuccessfully discharged due to not participating in counseling sessions and initiating fights with other juveniles, and from which J.M.E. could not be placed with parents after discharge due to inadequate supervision.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Southwest Keys Program: program completed after intensive supervision probation, part of J.M.E.'s rehabilitation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Youth Village: facility providing Cognitive Life Skills program as part of rehabilitation
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Webb County Jail: jail where J.M.E. was attending school and receiving services including CAPS counseling and SCAN services, and to which J.M.E. was transferred after assaulting another juvenile
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Counseling and Psychological Services: counseling services attended by J.M.E. as a condition of probation at Webb County Jail
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.SCAN Services: services received by J.M.E. at Webb County Jail
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Constitution: constitution under which complaint of cruel and unusual punishment was made, but the complaint was not preserved for appellate review
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Juvenile Court: court that ordered J.M.E.'s commitment to the Texas Juvenile Justice Department, heard testimony on J.M.E.'s unsuccessful discharge, handled J.M.E.'s previous probations, and found J.M.E. had violated probation terms, with authority to modify disposition based on violation of conditions.
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Intensive Supervision Probation: probation program that J.M.E. was placed on for four months
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Cognitive Life Skills Program: program attended by J.M.E. at Youth Village as part of rehabilitation
